virtual void runLoop ()=0
 The method will called in infinite loop created thread.

Detailed Description

The class create thread and start code in infinite loop in this thread.

Declaration:

 class InOtherThread : public mt::InfiniteThread {
   void runLoop() {
     //This code will work in infinite loop in other thread.
   }
 };

Usage: 

 InOtherThread thread;
 thread.start(); //Create and start thread.
 thread.stop(); //Stop thread.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void mt::InfiniteThread::runLoop (  )  [protected, pure virtual]

The method will called in infinite loop created thread.

Client MUST define this method.

Implemented in mt::OrderSafeProcessorHandler< DataIn, DataOut >, mt::LogCollector, mt::smpp::ClientInspector, mt::smpp::ClientProcessor, mt::smpp::Reciver, mt::smpp::Sender, mt::smpp::ServerProcessor, and mt::ConfigChecker.

void mt::InfiniteThread::start (  )  [virtual]

Create and start thread.

Exceptions:
mt::ThreadAlreadyRunningException if the thread already started.
mt::ThreadTooManyThreadsException if threads limit was reached.
mt::ThreadInvalidArgumentException if some of given arguments are invalid.
mt::ThreadNoMemoryException if no memory.
mt::ThreadCantStartException if other errors was occurred.
